name: FIN6
descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) is a cyber crime group that has stolen payment card data and sold it for profit on underground marketplaces. This group has aggressively targeted and compromised point of sale (PoS) systems in the hospitality and retail sectors.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Access Token Manipulation
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used has used Metasploit’s named-pipe impersonation technique to escalate privileges.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

subtechniques.name: Domain Account
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used Metasploit’s [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) NTDSGRAB module to obtain a copy of the victim's Active Directory database.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Archive Collected Data

subtechniques.name: Archive via Custom Method
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has encoded data gathered from the victim with a simple substitution cipher and single-byte XOR using the 0xAA key, and Base64 with character permutation.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: Trend Micro FIN6 October 2019)

technique_table_data.descr: Following data collection, [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has compressed log files into a ZIP archive prior to staging and exfiltration.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Automated Collection
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used a script to iterate through a list of compromised PoS systems, copy and remove data to a log file, and to bind to events from the submit payment button.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: Trend Micro FIN6 October 2019)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used Registry Run keys to establish persistence for its downloader tools known as HARDTACK and SHIPBREAD.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Password Cracking
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has extracted password hashes from ntds.dit to crack offline.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used scripting to iterate through a list of compromised PoS systems, copy data to a log file, and remove the original data files.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used PowerShell to gain access to merchant's networks, and a Metasploit PowerShell module to download and execute shellcode and to set up a local listener.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used kill.bat script to disable security tools.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

subtechniques.name: JavaScript
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used malicious JavaScript to steal payment card data from e-commerce sites.(Citation: Trend Micro FIN6 October 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Credentials from Password Stores
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used the Stealer One credential stealer to target e-mail and file transfer utilities including FTP.(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

subtechniques.name: Credentials from Web Browsers
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used the Stealer One credential stealer to target web browsers.(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Information Repositories
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has collected schemas and user accounts from systems running SQL Server.(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Local System
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has collected and exfiltrated payment card data from compromised systems.(Citation: Trend Micro FIN6 October 2019)(Citation: RiskIQ British Airways September 2018)(Citation: RiskIQ Newegg September 2018)

subtechniques.name: Remote Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) actors have compressed data from remote systems and moved it to another staging system before exfiltration.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Asymmetric Cryptography
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) used the Plink command-line utility to create SSH tunnels to C2 servers.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Exfiltration Over Unencrypted Non-C2 Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has sent stolen payment card data to remote servers via HTTP POSTs.(Citation: Trend Micro FIN6 October 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used tools to exploit Windows vulnerabilities in order to escalate privileges. The tools targeted CVE-2013-3660, CVE-2011-2005, and CVE-2010-4398, all of which could allow local users to access kernel-level privileges.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has deployed a utility script named kill.bat to disable anti-virus.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

subtechniques.name: File Deletion
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has removed files from victim machines.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Masquerade Task or Service
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has renamed the "psexec" service name to "mstdc" to masquerade as a legitimate Windows service.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Network Service Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) used publicly available tools (including Microsoft's built-in SQL querying tool, osql.exe) to map the internal network and conduct reconnaissance against Active Directory, Structured Query Language (SQL) servers, and NetBIOS.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

technique_table_data.name: Non-Application Layer Protocol
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used Metasploit Bind and Reverse TCP stagers.(Citation: Trend Micro FIN6 October 2019)

subtechniques.name: Command Obfuscation
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used encoded PowerShell commands.(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has obtained and used tools such as [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002), [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154), and [AdFind](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0552).(Citation: Security Intelligence More Eggs Aug 2019)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used [Windows Credential Editor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0005) for credential dumping.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

subtechniques.name: NTDS
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used Metasploit’s [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) NTDSGRAB module to obtain a copy of the victim's Active Directory database.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has targeted victims with e-mails containing malicious attachments.(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing via Service
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used fake job advertisements sent via LinkedIn to spearphish targets.(Citation: Security Intelligence More Eggs Aug 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Protocol Tunneling
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) used the Plink command-line utility to create SSH tunnels to C2 servers.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) used RDP to move laterally in victim networks.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) used publicly available tools (including Microsoft's built-in SQL querying tool, osql.exe) to map the internal network and conduct reconnaissance against Active Directory, Structured Query Language (SQL) servers, and NetBIOS.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used scheduled tasks to establish persistence for various malware it uses, including downloaders known as HARDTACK and SHIPBREAD and [FrameworkPOS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0503).(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)

subtechniques.name: Code Signing
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used Comodo code-signing certificates.(Citation: Security Intelligence More Eggs Aug 2019)

subtechniques.name: Service Execution
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has created Windows services to execute encoded PowerShell commands.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used malicious documents to lure victims into allowing execution of PowerShell scripts.(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Valid Accounts
technique_table_data.descr: To move laterally on a victim network, [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used credentials stolen from various systems on which it gathered usernames and password hashes.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Web Service
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used Pastebin and Google Storage to host content for their operations.(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

technique_table_data.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
technique_table_data.descr: [FIN6](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0037) has used WMI to automate the remote execution of PowerShell scripts.(Citation: Security Intelligence More Eggs Aug 2019)

software_data.name: FrameworkPOS
software_data.descr: (Citation: SentinelOne FrameworkPOS September 2019)(Citation: Crowdstrike Global Threat Report Feb 2018)(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

software_data.name: More_eggs
software_data.descr: (Citation: Security Intelligence More Eggs Aug 2019)(Citation: Visa FIN6 Feb 2019)

software_data.name: PsExec
software_data.descr: (Citation: FireEye FIN6 April 2016)(Citation: FireEye FIN6 Apr 2019)

techniques.name: File and Directory Permissions Modification
techniques.sub_name: Windows File and Directory Permissions Modification

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
